nodes.definition: The study of knowledge, its nature, sources, limits, and justification...
The study of the fundamental nature of reality, existence, and being...
The study of morality, right and wrong conduct, and what makes actions good or bad...
The study of valid reasoning, argument structure, and inference...
The study of conscious experience from the first-person perspective...
The study of beauty, art, taste, and the nature of aesthetic experience...
The study of government, justice, rights, law, and the enforcement of legal codes...
The study of the nature of mind, mental properties, consciousness, and their relationship to the bod...
The study of the foundations, methods, and implications of science...
Philosophy emphasizing individual existence, freedom, choice, and subjective experience...
The philosophical position questioning whether knowledge is possible...
Ethical theory that the right action maximizes overall happiness or well-being...
Ethical theory that actions are right or wrong based on rules and duties, not consequences...
Ethical theory focusing on character and virtues rather than rules or consequences...
Epistemological view that reason is the primary source of knowledge...
Epistemological view that experience is the primary source of knowledge...
Ratio of a structure's ultimate strength to its expected working load, accounting for uncertainties...
Internal force per unit area within a material arising from external loads...
Deformation of a material relative to its original dimensions...
Material stiffness parameter relating stress to strain in elastic region...
Stress level at which a material begins permanent plastic deformation...
Progressive structural damage under repeated cyclic loading...
Sudden lateral deformation of a slender structure under compressive load...
Change in dimensions of a material due to temperature change...
Movement of thermal energy between objects or within objects...
Study of fluid motion and forces in fluids...
System that manages, commands, directs or regulates behavior of other systems...
Determination of voltages and currents in electrical circuits...
Analysis, interpretation, and manipulation of signals...
Study of energy, heat, work, and their interconversion...
Process of choosing appropriate material for engineering application...
Numerical method for solving complex engineering problems by discretization...
Legal analysis framework: Issue, Rule, Application, Conclusion...
Prior court decision that establishes principle or rule for future cases...
Legal authority of a court to hear and decide a case...
Party's obligation to prove allegations or defenses...
Legally enforceable agreement between parties...
Civil wrong causing harm for which law provides remedy...
Failure to exercise reasonable care causing harm...
Liability without fault for certain activities or defective products...
Body of law derived from constitution interpreting governmental powers and rights...
Process of determining meaning and application of legislation...
Body of law defining crimes and punishments...
Information presented to prove or disprove facts at trial...
Legal or equitable relief granted by court...
Mental state or intent required for criminal liability...
Out-of-court statement offered to prove truth of matter asserted...
Revenues and costs associated with a single unit of product or customer...
Customer Acquisition Cost - total sales and marketing spend divided by new customers acquired...
Lifetime Value - total revenue expected from customer over entire relationship...
Percentage of customers who stop using product/service in given period...
Revenue minus cost of goods sold, expressed as percentage of revenue...
Rate at which company spends cash, typically monthly...
Degree to which product satisfies strong market demand...
Fundamental change to business model or product strategy...
Time until company runs out of cash at current burn rate...
Total Addressable Market, Serviceable Available Market, Serviceable Obtainable Market...
Minimum Viable Product - simplest version that tests core hypothesis...
Single metric that best captures core value delivered to customers...
Process of determining company's economic value...
Strategy for launching product and acquiring customers...
Sustainable edge that allows company to outperform competitors...
Arrangement of elements within a work to create coherent whole...
Structure of story from exposition through rising action, climax, falling action, to resolution...
Principles governing use and combination of colors...
Art and technique of arranging type to make written language legible and appealing...
Process of creating complex, believable characters with depth and growth...
Distinctive style and personality in writing...
Arrangement of elements to guide viewer's eye and emphasize importance...
Pattern of regular or irregular pulses in time or space...
Building anticipation or discomfort followed by resolution or satisfaction...
Reveal character and story through action and sensory details rather than exposition...
Juxtaposition of differing elements to create visual or conceptual interest...
Figure of speech comparing two unlike things by stating one is the other...
Psychological principles describing how humans perceive patterns and wholes...
Narrative perspective from which story is told...
Empty space in design that gives elements room to breathe...
Systematic pattern of deviation from rationality in judgment...
Statistical relationship (correlation) does not imply one variable causes the other (causation)...
Defining abstract concepts in measurable terms for research...
Extent to which research findings generalize beyond the specific study...
Concept or practice that exists because people agree it exists, not from objective reality...
Probability of obtaining results at least as extreme as observed, assuming null hypothesis is true...
Magnitude of relationship or difference, independent of sample size...
Inferring individual-level relationships from group-level data...
Finding that many published research results fail to replicate...
Systematic error from non-representative sample...
Ability to attribute mental states (beliefs, desires, intentions) to others...
Exposure to stimulus influences response to subsequent stimulus...
Structure for testing causal hypotheses through manipulation and control...
Degree to which measurement captures theoretical construct it intends to measure...
Tendency to answer questions in manner viewed favorably by others...
Memory safety violation where data exceeds buffer boundary, overwriting adjacent memory...
Code injection where attacker inserts malicious SQL into application queries...
Cross-Site Scripting - injecting malicious scripts into trusted websites...
Return-Oriented Programming - chaining existing code gadgets to bypass DEP/NX...
Gaining higher permissions than initially granted...
Practice of secure communication through encoding and decoding...
Analyzing compiled code to understand functionality and find vulnerabilities...
Address Space Layout Randomization - randomizing memory addresses to hinder exploitation...
Vulnerability where untrusted input is used as format string, allowing read/write primitives...
Timing-dependent bug where outcome depends on sequence/timing of uncontrollable events...
Automated testing technique feeding malformed/unexpected inputs to find bugs...
Server-Side Request Forgery - forcing server to make unintended requests...
Converting serialized data back to objects - vulnerable when untrusted data deserialized...
Moving through network after initial compromise to reach target systems...
Hiding information within other non-secret data...
Model learns training data too well including noise, failing to generalize to new data...
Balance between model's ability to fit training data (bias) and generalize to new data (variance)...
Creating new features or transforming existing ones to improve model performance...
Model evaluation technique partitioning data into train/test folds multiple times...
Reducing number of features while preserving important information...
Combining multiple models to improve predictions beyond individual models...
Optimization algorithm iteratively moving toward minimum by following negative gradient...
Table showing classification model's predictions vs actual labels...
Training data contains information about test data, leading to overly optimistic performance...
Dataset where classes are not represented equally...
Technique adding penalty term to loss function to prevent overfitting...
Experimental design comparing two versions to determine which performs better...
Analyzing data points ordered in time to identify patterns and forecast...
Grouping data points into clusters based on similarity...
Computational model inspired by biological neurons, learning through backpropagation...
